generic.fatalRuntimeError:
An error has occurred which has forced the game to stop.
Please contact the game's developer
or run game in debug mode.

welcome_modal.hide_welcome: Hide welcome screen from now on

editor_main.error_opening_html:
An error occurred when trying to open the project.
Please make sure the file you selected is a game exported using Ed, and not another file.
editor_main.error_reading_project:
An error occurred when trying to read the project data.
The project file you are trying to open might be corrupt.
editor_main.fatalRuntimeError:
An error has occurred which has forced the game to stop.
Run the game in debug mode for more info.

asset_browser.title: Asset Browser
asset_browser.no_assets: No assets in this list yet
asset_browser.confirm_delete: You are about to delete "{assetName}." Are you sure?

art_editor.frame_limit: Wow, you've managed to reach the maximum amount of sprite frames! (4096)

object_editor.tt_sprite:
Which drawing this object should display when placed in the level.
If no drawing is selected, the object will use a placeholder in the editor, and be invisible in game.
object_editor.tt_start_frame: The frame which the animation will start on
object_editor.tt_fps:
How many animation frames should play each second.
Higher number means the animation will be faster
object_editor.tt_loop:
Toggles whether or not the animation should loop when it's played.
If off, animation will freeze on the last frame
object_editor.tt_is_playing: Set if the animation plays on start
object_editor.tt_depth: Places objects in front or behind othe objects
object_editor.tt_solid: Toggles whether or not other objects will react to colliding with this object
object_editor.tt_gravity: Toggles whether or not this object is affected by the room's gravity
object_editor.tt_trigger_exits: Toggles whether or not the object should trigger a room change when it collides with an exit
object_editor.tt_exit_behavior: Sets what happens to object when it triggers an exit
object_editor.tt_keep_camera_settings: Current camera settings will get transferred to next room
object_editor.tt_logic_script: Select a custom logic script for this object to use
object_editor.tt_goto_logic: Open logic script in logic editor
object_editor.tt_groups:
Add custom groups the instance should belong to.
Can be used when scripting to get different instances which have the same group

room_editor.no_room_selected: Add a room, and select it to start editing
room_editor.no_selection: Select an instance to edit it's properties
room_editor.no_tool_props: Current selected tool has no properties
room_editor.tt_coll_ovr:
Change the collision type for this instance only.
"Keep" will keep the original object's value
room_editor.tt_cust_depth:
Change what order this instance is drawn on top of others.
Higher number = On Top
room_editor.tt_cust_inst_vars:
Add custom variables to this instance.
These can be read in the Logic to make this instance unique
room_editor.tt_anim_play:
Make this instance play automatically.
✔ = Play
⬜ = Pause
room_editor.tt_anim_play_triple:
Make this instance play automatically.
✔ = Play
⬜ = Pause
- = Keep setting from object
room_editor.tt_anim_loop:
Make this instance loop automatically.
✔ = Loop
⬜ = Stop on last frame
room_editor.tt_anim_loop_triple:
Make this instance loop automatically.
✔ = Loop
⬜ = Stop on last frame
- = Keep setting from object
room_editor.tt_start_frame: Make this instance start on a different frame than the others.
room_editor.tt_start_frame_nullable: Make this instance start on a different frame than the others. Leave empty to keep original object settings
room_editor.tt_fps: Set the animation playback speed of this instance. Negative values will cause the animation to play in reverse
room_editor.tt_fps_nullable: Set the animation playback speed of this instance. Negative values will cause the animation to play in reverse. Leave empty to keep original object settings
room_editor.tt_copy_selected_instance: The brush will paint copies of the instance which is selected in the editor
room_editor.tt_allow_overlap: Allow instances of the same type to be painted on top of each other
room_editor.tt_paint_at_depth:
Specify a depth to add new instances at.

If left blank they will be added at the default depth
room_editor.tt_erase_top_only: Only erase the instance which is on top of others in the cell
room_editor.tt_erase_selected_type: Only erase instances that are the same type as the selected asset
room_editor.tt_delete_all_selected: Delete all instances of the selected asset type
room_editor.tt_camera_size:
Sets the "Zoom" of the camera.
Larger number means more things on screen
room_editor.tt_camera_move:
Set what type of motion the camera has.
Locked: Camera is still
Follow: Camera follows an object
Scroll: Camera scrolls at a constant rate in the chosen direction
room_editor.tt_camera_scroll_dir: Set which direction the camera should scroll in
room_editor.tt_camera_scroll_speed: Set the speed that the camera will scroll
room_editor.tt_camera_follow_obj: The camera will follow the selected instance
room_editor.tt_camera_follow_type:
Select style of motion the camera should use when following an object.
Smooth: Object will always be near center of screen
Tiled: Object must reach edge of screen before camera moves
room_editor.tt_exit_detect_backtrack: If enabled, when used as a destination this exit will detect when the player immediately tries to go back through the exit
room_editor.tt_exit_is_ending:
Toggle if exit ends game or not.
Endings display the ending dialog when triggered
room_editor.tt_exit_trans: Style of transition to use when switching rooms
room_editor.tt_exit_dest_room: Select the room which the exit will lead to
room_editor.tt_exit_dest_exit: Select the specific exit that this one will lead to
room_editor.tt_exit_end_dialog: This text will be displayed on screen after the exit is triggered
room_editor.tt_exit_delete: Deletes the exit from the room
room_editor.tt_room_background: Change the background color of the room
room_editor.tt_room_persist:
Keep any changes made to this room while playing.
Objects that are added, changed, or removed will keep changes when you leave and return to this room.
WARNING: These changes will only stick around while the game is running, and will not be saved if the player closes the game
room_editor.tt_room_use_gravity: Turn gravity on or off for this room.
room_editor.tt_room_gravity: Set how strong the gravity is in this room
room_editor.tt_room_starting_room: Set this room to load when the game starts

logic_editor.node_panel_empty_warning: Add a graph to start adding nodes
logic_editor.name: Name
logic_editor.local_global_name_warning:
A global variable exists with the same name.

When calling from the same Logic script, the local variable will be used instead.
logic_editor.variable_length_warning:
Character limit reached.

Max length of a variable is {limit} characters.
logic_editor.variable_name_change_warning: Changing the name will result in all references to the variable being updated automatically.
logic_editor.variable_name_spaces: A variable name cannot contain spaces
logic_editor.variable_incompatible_type_warning: Type of "{newType}" is incompatible with the previous type of "{oldType}". All incompatible connections will be removed.
logic_editor.confirm_break_connections:
Warning: The following variable "{var}" is already in use and is connected to sockets incompatable with type "{type}".

Break incompatable connections?

node.create_var_confirm:
Warning: You are about to delete a variable node. All connections related to this variable will be broken.

Are you sure?
node.create_var_confirm_multiple:
Warning: You are about to delete multiple variables. All connections related to these variables will be broken.

Are you sure?

Variables to be deleted: {varList}
node.error_var_not_found: Error: No variable found with that name.
node.name: Name
node.label: Label
